message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

This paper is about improving policy gradient algorithms in reinforcement learning by refining the sampling process. It proposes a new method called SAUNA that rejects transitions from the gradient updates if they do not meet a particular criterion, and kept otherwise. The paper conducts experiments across a variety of benchmark environments, including standard continuous control problems, which suggests that the proposed method is applicable to a wide range of problems. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.RO (Robotics). Additionally, since the paper deals with control problems, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also a likely sub-category. Finally, since the paper uses computer vision techniques to evaluate the impact of each transition, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is also a possible sub-category.
